meanings.definition: To catch more fish than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Tommy can outfish his brother in the lake.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outfish her friends during fishing trips.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to outfish her dad, but he caught the biggest fish.
meanings.sent4: The experienced angler can outfish any competitor in the tournament.
meanings.sent5: Outfishing requires patience and skill to succeed.

meanings.sent1: With his new techniques, he can outfish even the most experienced fishermen.
meanings.sent2: She trained hard to outfish her mentor and become the best angler in town.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's goal was to outfish all his rivals and win the fishing contest.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outfish everyone else made him practice fishing every day.
meanings.sent5: Outfishing is not just about luck; it requires dedication and knowledge of the waters.
